channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The starting salary for a new American Airlines flight attendant is low enough to qualify for food stamps in some states
item.description: Legislation prevents workers from striking without permission from the government.

item.title: Hedge funds are getting selective with megacap tech, falling out of love with Tesla and Apple
item.description: Hedge funds dialed back their exposure to Tesla, Alphabet and Apple last quarter, while Microsoft remained the most popular stock.

item.title: Congress can give crypto a big boost this week
Cyberattacks are soaring—and more lucrative for criminals than drugs. It's time to treat them as an 'act of war', health care exec warns
item.description: Cybercrime profits now surpass "all of the illegal drug trafficking in the world combined," Verily CEO Stephen Gillett said at Fortune's Brainstorm Health conference.

item.title: First Solar earnings could surge 370% as Big Tech hunts for renewables to power AI, UBS says
item.description: UBS said First Solar is "an overlooked, direct beneficiary of increasing AI-driven electricity demand."

item.title: Microsoft’s stock rides AI elation toward first record close in two months
Jamie Dimon shocks Wall Street, hinting at his retirement in the next five years and reciting a laundry list of red flags about the global economy
item.description: Dimon says he’s “cautiously pessimistic” about the future of inflation, spending, and the geopolitical landscape.

item.title: Biden to sell 1 million barrels of gasoline to reduce prices at the pump ahead of July 4
item.description: The Biden administration will release 1 million barrels of gasoline from reserves held in the Northeast to reduce prices ahead of the July 4 holiday.

item.title: Two-thirds of Americans say inflation has made their financial situation worse
Tech companies are voluntarily agreeing to an AI ‘kill switch’ to prevent Terminator-style risks as some regulators remain hesitant to flex their legal muscles
item.description: Developers and governments reach consensus, but “toothless” commitments fall short of formal global legal frameworks.

item.title: Google is letting retailers include 3D images in AI-generated ads
item.description: Google is giving advertisers the ability to create immersive visuals in their online promotions.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs would cost U.S. families $1,700 a year, think tank says
Health care workforce challenges must be addressed to support Black mothers
item.description: In order to serve Black mothers, the healthcare workforce must properly focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion.

item.title: Pixar is laying off 14% of its workforce as Disney scales back content
item.description: About 14% of the workforce at Disney's Pixar Animation Studios, or around 175 employees, are being laid off.

item.title: UBS says investors shouldn’t worry about Target’s new discounts
